constructor.notice: Tracks Bitcoin starting from a given block. The isTestnet          argument is necessary because the Bitcoin testnet does not          respect the difficulty rules, so we disable block difficulty          checks in order to track it.

getBlockHash(uint256).notice: Returns the Bitcoin block hash at a specific height.

getLatestBlockHeight().notice: Returns the height of the current chain tip.

getLatestBlockTime().notice: Returns the timestamp of the current chain tip.

isTestnet().notice: Whether we're tracking testnet or mainnet Bitcoin.

longestReorg().notice: The longest reorg that this BtcMirror instance has observed.

periodToTarget(uint256).notice: Difficulty targets in each retargeting period.

submit(uint256,bytes).notice: Submits a new Bitcoin chain segment. Must be heavier (not necessarily longer) than the chain rooted at getBlockHash(getLatestBlockHeight()).
